nodes.text: Omar Berenko was a famous and controversial male human poet from Naboo who lived several centuries before the Separatist Crisis, during the High Republic Era. Berenko lived in Varykino, a lake retreat in Naboo's Lake Country, in an unconventional community of Naboo and Gungan outsiders. He notably wrote Defense of Naboo, an epic and disturbing poem, in the Room of Morning Mists.

Around 232 BBY, Jedi Master Avar Kriss and Jedi Knight Elzar Mann visited the San Tekka compound near Varykino. The island caught Kriss' eye, and Mann told her about Varykino and Berenko, who was living there at the time. Mann noted that Berenko had a reputation for being brilliant.

Eventually, Berenko was mysteriously kidnapped by unknown assailants at the retreat house, at the exact same spot where Anakin Skywalker and Padmé Amidala would be secretly wed at the start of the Clone Wars. After his abduction, the poet was never seen or heard from again.
Omar Berenko was first canonically mentioned in the 2016 edition of the reference book Star Wars: Complete Locations, following on from being mentioned in the 2005 Legends edition.
Berenko shares his name with House Berenko and New Republic senator Thadlé Berenko, both of which also hail from Naboo. Any connection beyond the name has not been confirmed.
